comments:
I postetd this to the newsgroup:
When I create a SWT visual class, I get an error. In a fresh installed environment (Eclipse 3.0.1, 
EMF2.0.1, GEF 3.0.0 and VE 1.0.1) the error ist different from the one posted to the newsgroup. 
This ist the entry in the .log:

!SESSION Mrz 24, 2005 16:16:20.524 ---------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=M200409161125
java.version=1.4.2_05
java.vendor=Apple Computer, Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=macosx, ARCH=ppc, WS=carbon, NL=de_DE
Command-line arguments: -keyring /Users/tpn/.eclipse_keyring -showlocation

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ve.java.core 4 0 Mrz 24, 2005 16:16:20.528
!MESSAGE SyntaxError: The type java.lang.Object cannot be resolved. It is indirectly referenced from 
required .class files

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.ui 4 10001 Mrz 24, 2005 16:16:20.796
!MESSAGE Internal Error
!STACK 0
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext.run(ModalContext.java:284)
        at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.run(WizardDialog.java:752)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.NewElementWizard.performFinish(NewElementWizard.java:
115)
        at 
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.wizards.NewVisualClassCreationWizard.performFinish(NewVisualCl
assCreationWizard.java:407)
        at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.finishPressed(WizardDialog.java:609)

Regards

    Thomas P. Niesel

SWT support for OS X simply hasn't been worked on yet.  This bug could probably
be marked as a duplicate of 58022.
SWT development on OS X is now supported as of VE 1.2 M1. Please try it out and let us know what you think :)
